column2: You are still hard at work, I see?

column2: Its deplorable peculiarity was, that it was the faintness of solitude and disuse.

column2: It was like the last feeble echo of a sound made long and long ago.

column2: So sunken and suppressed it was, that it was like a voice underground.

column2: So expressive it was, of a hopeless and lost creature, that a famished traveller, wearied out by lonely wandering in a wilderness, would have remembered home and friends in such a tone before lying down to die.
